intro: Hieracium reversidens, commonly known as the reverse hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are generally hairy and have a serrated edge, while the flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium reversidens is often found in temperate climates and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
